image:image.image:title: AI-native L&D workflows for small teams
image:image.image:caption: A practical AI-native L&D workflow for small teams that balances speed, instructional quality, and governance.

image:image.image:title: Design decision-quality training that builds practical judgment instead of compliance
image:image.image:caption: Teams often default to compliance-focused training when they need to improve decision quality. One company redesigned their approach to build judgment instead.

image:image.image:title: Build feedback rituals that convert learning into visible team behavior
image:image.image:caption: Teams often treat feedback as a one-time event that fades quickly. Effective rituals turn learning into ongoing behavior changes.

image:image.image:title: Create L&D reviews that focus on behavior shifts not completion dashboards
image:image.image:caption: Shifting L&D reviews from completion dashboards to behavior-focused conversations builds real impact.

image:image.image:title: Create learning opportunities that build judgment through real decisions
image:image.image:caption: Create learning opportunities that build judgment through real decisions, not simulated scenarios.

image:image.image:title: Build learning culture that supports judgment over compliance
image:image.image:caption: Build learning culture that supports judgment over compliance to create environments where teams experiment and learn.

image:image.image:title: Improve judgment without adding course fatigue
image:image.image:caption: Practice judgment in actual work contexts to build skills without adding course fatigue.

image:image.image:title: Design learning prompts that improve decisions during real project pressure
image:image.image:caption: Use decision-focused prompts during project work to surface assumptions and reduce pressure-induced errors.

image:image.image:title: Coach managers to run better learning conversations in weekly ones
image:image.image:caption: Coach managers to run better learning conversations in weekly ones that surface learning and make adjustments faster.

image:image.image:title: Help cross functional teams learn faster through shared project retrospectives
image:image.image:caption: Help cross functional teams learn faster through shared project retrospectives that capture lessons across disciplines.

image:image.image:title: Design onboarding that builds role judgment instead of checklist compliance
image:image.image:caption: Teach decision making not just knowledge to help employees make better judgments on the job.

image:image.image:title: Design data-informed learning programs that show business impact
image:image.image:caption: Use data to surface where learning transfers and where it doesn't to measure and improve learning transfer.

image:image.image:title: Use reflective debriefs after projects to strengthen learning transfer
image:image.image:caption: Projects often end without intentional reflection. One company built reflective debriefs into their project lifecycle to strengthen learning transfer.

image:image.image:title: Design manager enablement that links coaching actions to team capability growth
image:image.image:caption: Design manager enablement that links coaching actions to team capability growth, not just coach skill improvement.

image:image.image:title: Micro-learning for daily decision making
image:image.image:caption: Micro-learning for daily decision making delivers context-aware support exactly when managers face a decision, improving outcomes without overwhelming their schedules.

image:image.image:title: Make learning evidence useful for business reviews without heavy reporting overhead
image:image.image:caption: A practical way to make learning evidence useful in business reviews without adding reporting overhead.

image:image.image:title: Design learning for retention, not just compliance
image:image.image:caption: Retention beats compliance when you create meaningful reasons for people to engage repeatedly.

image:image.image:title: Design gamification that actually improves performance
image:image.image:caption: Meaningful gamification aligns incentives with real performance and creates sustainable behavior change.

image:image.image:title: Practical AI tools for learning designers
image:image.image:caption: Human-centered AI works best when humans make the final decisions about learning quality and relevance.

image:image.image:title: Use data-informed learning decisions, not assumptions
image:image.image:caption: Data beats intuition when you use it to inform decisions, not justify them. Small, consistent data-informed changes compound faster than big assumptions.

image:image.image:title: Build a practical LxD workflow for small teams shipping weekly
image:image.image:caption: Build a practical LxD workflow for small teams shipping weekly that focuses on rapid iteration and team ownership.

image:image.image:title: Design learning for decision quality not completion rates
image:image.image:caption: Learning design often traps us in a completion game. We track how many courses learners finish instead of how well they apply what they learned.

image:image.image:title: Design without losing human judgment
image:image.image:caption: AI tools keep appearing faster than anyone can integrate them into learning design.

image:image.image:title: Design gamification for decision quality, not points
image:image.image:caption: Gamification works when mechanics reinforce better decisions and measurable capability growth, not when they only reward participation.

image:image.image:title: AI feedback works only when it supports human coaching
image:image.image:caption: AI feedback creates value when it amplifies human coaching and improves real decisions, not when it just increases message volume.

image:image.image:title: Game-based learning should change behavior, not just engagement
image:image.image:caption: Game-based learning is useful only when it changes decisions and behavior in real work, not when it just raises participation.

image:image.image:title: The Object Without Attachment
image:image.image:caption: Humans are wired to bond with things we work through, not just finish. When AI compresses effort, you get the result without the emotional imprint that normally makes it feel yours.

image:image.image:title: Where we go from here
image:image.image:caption: Where we go from here discusses dataâ€‘backed strategies for embedding learning in daily workflows, boosting performance and judgment.

image:image.image:title: If everyone is losing jobs, who pays for AI infrastructure?
image:image.image:caption: If everyone is losing jobs, who pays for AI infrastructure? It is funded by concentrated capital and by customers, and the risk is who gets left out.

image:image.image:title: Accelerando and the future of L&D
image:image.image:caption: When AI is embedded in workflows, performance support is dead and L&D shifts to shaping how work gets done.

image:image.image:title: AI Hype vs Adoption
image:image.image:caption: Everything around AI is overhyped for retention. But how much is actually getting adopted into daily workflows?

image:image.image:title: The Art vs Craft of Building with Code
image:image.image:caption: Tools make implementation easier, but they don't solve the harder problem of designing systems that actually work.

image:image.image:title: Publishing Without the WordPress Headache
image:image.image:caption: I keep coming back to a simple question: can I get my ideas onto my website without the WordPress circus?

image:image.image:title: The Human Edge
image:image.image:caption: Why human context windows still matter, even as AI gets faster and cheaper with smaller prompts.

image:image.image:title: Skills in L&D
image:image.image:caption: We're attracted to skills systems without understanding maintenance. The focus should be embedding skills in AI systems first.
